com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.attribute

Class Geoshape

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.attribute.Geoshape

  • public class Geoshape
extends Object
    A generic representation of a geographic shape, which can either be a single point, circle, box, or polygon. Use getType() to determine the type of shape of a particular Geoshape object. Use the static constructor methods to create the desired geoshape. Note, polygons are not yet supported.
    Author:
    Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Geoshape.Point
      A single point representation.
      static class  Geoshape.Type
      The Type of a shape: a point, box, circle, or polygon

      • getType

        public Geoshape.Type getType()
        Returns the Geoshape.Type of this geoshape.
        Returns:

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of points comprising this geoshape. A point and circle have only one point (center of cricle), a box has two points (the south-west and north-east corners) and a polygon has a variable number of points (>=3).
        Returns:

      • getPoint

        public Geoshape.Point getPoint(int position)
        Returns the point at the given position. The position must be smaller than size().
        Parameters:
        position -
        Returns:

      • getPoint

        public Geoshape.Point getPoint()
        Returns the singleton point of this shape. Only applicable for point and circle shapes.
        Returns:

      • getRadius

        public float getRadius()
        Returns the radius in kilometers of this circle. Only applicable to circle shapes.
        Returns:
